page.title: 20BUCKLAND NEWTON V.C.PRIMARY
page.content: The school, which was built in 1857, originally only served the children of the Parish.When the school leaving age rose to 15 years of age,{Buckland {Newton}developed as an all age school serving five neighbouring villages and covering an area of 40 square kilometres.In 1960, secondary schools began to be opened in{Sherborne, {Sturminster Newton}and{Puddletown}, and {Buckland Newton}was designated a primary school.This change caused a large drop in numbers on roll(1957:156 children. 1960:88 children.) Later numbers rose again when the village schools at{Pulham,Glanvilles Wootton and{Mappowder}closed onto{Buckland {Newton.}The present number on roll is 72 with a teaching head teacher,2 assistants and a part time teacher. ************************************** **************************************
